intro: Leucothoe latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf leucothoe, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It features attractive, lance-shaped leaves that turn reddish in the fall, adding visual interest to the landscape. The plant produces small, bell-shaped white flowers in the spring, which are followed by dark blue berries in the summer. It thrives in partial to full shade and prefers moist, well-drained soils. Broadleaf leucothoe is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in woodland gardens.
